verses.verse: And after this Jesus traveled in Galilee, for he would not travel in Judea, because the Jews were seeking to kill him.
Now the Jewish Festival of Tabernacles was near.
Then his brothers said to him, "Get out of here and go to Judea, so you disciples may also see the your works that you do,
for no one does anything in secret, for he seeks publicity. If you do these things, show yourself to the world."
For not even his brothers believed in him.
Then Jesus said to them, "The right time for me is not yet come, but your time is always ready.
"The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, because I testify against it, that its works are evil.
"You go up to this festival; I'm not going up yet, my time has not fully come."
After saying this to them, he remained in Galilee.
But after his brothers had gone up, then he went up to the festival, too, not openly but even as in secret.
Then the Jews were persistently looking for him at the festival, and kept asking, "Where is he?"
There was a lot of whispering in the crowd concerning him, for some people said, "He is a good man," but others said, "He deceives the people."
Nevertheless, no one spoke about him openly, for fear of the Jews.
Now about the middle of the festival Jesus went up to the temple and taught.
The Jews were amazed saying, "How can this man know so much, when he has never been educated?"
Jesus answered them and said, "My teaching is not my own but the one who sent me.
"If anyone wants to do his will, he will know the teaching if it is from God, or if I am speaking from myself.
"The one who speaks from himself is seeking for his own glory, but the one who is seeking for glory for the one who sent him is true and no unrighteousness is in him.
"Didn't Moses give you the law? Yet none of you do the law. Why do you seek to kill me?"
The crowd responded and said, "You have a demon. Who seeks to kill you?"
Jesus answered and said to them, "I did one work, and all of you are shocked.
"That's why Moses gave you circumcision (not because it is from Moses but from the Fathers), and you on the Sabbath circumcise a man.
"If a man on the Sabbath receives circumcision, so that Moses' law should not be broken, are you angry with me, because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?
"Do not judge by outward appearance, but judge righteous judgment."
Then some of those from Jerusalem said, "Isn't this the one whom they seek to kill?
«But look, he speaks boldly, and they say nothing to him. Can it be that the rulers really know that this is truly the Christ?
«But we know where this man is from, but when Christ comes no one will know where he is from.»
Then Jesus shouted as he taught in the temple, saying, "You know me and know where I am from. I have not come on my own, on the contrary he who sent me is true, whom you do not know.
"But I know him, for I am from him, and he has sent me."
Then they were seeking to capture him, but no one laid hands on him, because his hour hadn't come.
But many of the people believed in him and said, "When Christ comes will he do more miracles than these which this [man] has done?"
The Pharisees heard the people whispering these about him, so the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to arrest him.
Then Jesus said to them, "I am with you only a little while longer, then I leave to the one who sent me.
"You will seek me and find not me, and where I am, you cannot come."
Then the Jews said to one another, "Where will he go, that we will not find him? Will he go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
"What is this statement he said: «You will seek me and not find me, and where I am, you cannot come?»
On the last day, the most important day of the festival, Jesus stood up and shouted saying, "If any one thirsts, come to me and drink.
"He who believes in me, as the Scripture said rivers of living water will flow from his innermost being."
He said this about the Spirit, which those who believe in him were about to receive, for the Holy Spirit was not yet [given], because Jesus was not yet glorified.
Then many of the people hearing this statement said, "Truly this is the prophet."
Others said, "This is the Christ." Others, however, said, "Christ doesn't come from Galilee.
"Hasn't the Scriptures said that Christ comes the posterity of David and from the town of Bethlehem where David was?"
So there was a division among the people because of him.
Some of them wanted to arrest him, but no one laid hands on him.
Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, «Why haven't you brought him?»
The officers answered, "No man never spoke like this man."
Then the Pharisees answered them, "You haven't been deceived, too, have you?
"Have any of the rulers or Pharisees believed in him?
"But this crowd doesn't know the law; they are cursed."
Nicodemus (the one who came to Jesus at night, being one of them) said to them, Joh 7:51 "Our law does not condemn the person before hearing from him and knowing what he did."
They answered and said to him, "Are you also from Galilee? Search and look, for no prophet rises up from Galilee."
Then each one went to his own home.
